Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. -PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of DeSoto, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of DeSoto, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in DeSoto Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of DeSoto Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SummaryText:
Town of Logansport Proposition

Summary:  Authority for the Town of Logansport to issue not exceeding $1,135,000 of its sewer revenue bonds to run not exceeding 22 years from the date thereof for the purpose of acquiring and constructing improvements and replacements to the sewerage system of the Town, including equipment and furnishings therefor, said bonds to be payable solely from the income and revenues derived or to be derived from the operation of said revenue producing public utility.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Logansport, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), issue its sewer revenue bonds in an amount not to exceed One Million One Hundred Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars ($1,135,000) to run not exceeding twenty-two (22) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate of not exceeding ninety-five hundredths of one percent per centum (0.95%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and constructing improvements and replacements to the sewerage system of the Town, including equipment and furnishings therefor, said bonds to be payable solely from the income and revenues derived or to be derived from the operation of said revenue producing utility, pursuant to the provisions of Part VII, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950 and other constitutional and statutory authority?
